meanings.definition: A person or group that resists change or refuses to agree with others.
meanings.sent1: The holdouts in the meeting were the only ones who disagreed with the new plan.
meanings.sent2: The holdouts in the community always prefer to stick to the old ways.
meanings.sent3: The holdouts at the party insisted on playing board games while everyone else danced.
meanings.sent4: Despite the storm, the holdouts in the park continued their picnic without a care.
meanings.sent5: The holdouts in the class stood firm in their belief, even when others tried to convince them otherwise.

meanings.definition: The act of holding out or resisting.
meanings.sent1: The holdouts of the protesters lasted for hours before they finally dispersed.
meanings.sent2: The holdouts of the negotiations delayed the agreement from being reached.
meanings.sent3: The holdouts of the children in the game of tag made it more challenging for the others.
meanings.sent4: The holdouts of the old building against demolition surprised many in the town.
meanings.sent5: The holdouts of the team's defense were crucial in preventing the opponent from scoring.
